column4: I used Wubi before tried it once didn't boot my machine up after a successful install
Were you at least still able to boot Windows or did it completely screw up ntldr?
Wasn't able to boot Windows or Ubuntu

You should file a bug if you havn't already, wubi is supposed to be the "safer" way because it does not require repartitioning, that it screwed up ntldr is unacceptable ( and should be easily avoidable )
they probably fixed it though seeing as I did this a while back like a couple of months back
also seeing as Wubi is in Beta that's most likely the cause of the issue hehe
What exactly happened, did you see a boot menu at all when you started the computer?
The grub menu came up and I hit enter on Ubuntu then it just went black and stayed there
Did you use the wubi from the Ubuntu 7.10 install CD?
never knew Wubi was on the Ubuntu 7.10 LiveCD/Install CD
Was on Windows XP Home downloaded Wubi installed it from there rebooted tried to load Ubuntu screen went black
It's not really full Wubi, it just let's you boot from the install CD without changing any BIOS settings
There are 64 bit packages for zsnex in the default Ubuntu repositories.
In the Software Center it doesn't exist it shows it but than tells me it isn't there.
Looks like I was simply mistaken. Sorry.

I assure you I have already read the channel topic. I'd rather not discuss at length what is offtopic for Ubuntu here, as it would be ironically somewhat offtopic. If you'd like to continue discussing this please join #ubuntu-ops.
Both I and bazhang are ops in this channel. If you'd like to continue discussing this please join #ubuntu-ops.
